final_answer.explanation: The official documentary film of the 1982 FIFA World Cup, which was held in Spain, is titled "G'olé!". The film is narrated by Sean Connery, a well-known Scottish actor. This information is confirmed by the data provided in the context regarding the FIFA World Cup official films, specifically highlighting the narrator associated with the 1982 tournament. The film captures the essence of the World Cup, including key moments and highlights from the tournament, which Italy won by defeating West Germany in the final.

graph.title: Find Film Title
graph.content: <1009>[Find Film Title] Identify the title of the official documentary film for the 1982 FIFA World Cup.</1009>
graph.answer:
The 1982 FIFA World Cup, held in Spain from June 13 to July 11, was a significant tournament in football history. It was won by Italy, who defeated West Germany 3-1 in the final at the Santiago Bernabéu Stadium in Madrid. This tournament was notable for several reasons: it featured the first penalty shoot-out in World Cup history, and it was the last World Cup to have two rounds of group stages. Additionally, it marked the first appearances of several teams, including Algeria, Cameroon, Honduras, Kuwait, and New Zealand.

The official documentary film of the tournament is titled "G'olé!". Narrated by Sean Connery, the film chronicles the key events of the World Cup, including Italy's journey to victory and highlights the performances of teams like New Zealand and Cameroon, the latter being recognized as a rising force in African football. The film captures the excitement and drama of the matches, showcasing the tournament's impact on the global football landscape.

Finally, the third task will verify the details of the 1982 FIFA World Cup to provide context and ensure the accuracy of the information related to the film. Each task is designed to build towards answering the main question without overlapping in focus.

graph.title: Find Film Narrator
graph.content: <1010>[Find Film Narrator] Look up the narrator of the official documentary film of the 1982 FIFA World Cup.</1010>
graph.answer:
The findings regarding the 1982 FIFA World Cup have been consolidated as follows:

- **Title of the Official Documentary Film**: "G'olé!"
- **Narrator**: Sean Connery
- **Key Events from the Tournament**: The tournament was held in Spain from June 13 to July 11, 1982. Italy won the tournament by defeating West Germany 3-1 in the final match at the Santiago Bernabéu Stadium in Madrid. This victory marked Italy's third World Cup title, their first since 1938. The tournament also featured the first penalty shoot-out in World Cup history and was notable for the large margin of victory in the match between Hungary and El Salvador, where Hungary won 10-1.
